news_header: African giant pouched rats are being trained to detect illegally smuggled wildlife products.
news_text: Researchers are training African giant pouched rats to identify illegal wildlife products such as pangolin scales and elephant ivory. These rats, equipped with an exceptional sense of smell, could help combat wildlife trafficking at ports. The training involves teaching the rats to distinguish specific scents and signal their findings. While some rats are now deployed in real ports, others are enjoying retirement in a dedicated colony.
